# Documentation Instructions

## Technology Stack

- Docusaurus 3.7.0 for documentation generation
- React 19 for components
- TypeScript for configuration
- Mermaid for diagrams
- FontAwesome for icons
- pnpm for package management

## Folder Structure

- `docs/github-pages/`: Docusaurus documentation site
  - `docs/`: Documentation content in Markdown
    - `cli/`: CLI command documentation
    - `contributing/`: Contribution guidelines
    - `export/`: Export features documentation
    - `getting-started/`: Getting started guides
    - `installation/`: Installation instructions
    - `themes/`: Theme documentation
    - `validation/`: Validation documentation
  - `src/`: React components, CSS, and pages
  - `static/`: Static assets (images, sample files)
  - `docusaurus.config.ts`: Main configuration
  - `sidebars.ts`: Sidebar navigation structure

## Documentation Guidelines

- Write documentation in Markdown format.
- Organize documentation into clear sections with logical hierarchy.
- Use code blocks with proper syntax highlighting.
- Include practical examples for complex concepts.
- Use Mermaid diagrams for architecture and flow diagrams.
- Ensure all links and references are functional.
- Keep documentation up-to-date with codebase changes.
